{"step_by_step_thinking": "Clavulanic acid is a β-lactamase inhibitor. β-lactamases are enzymes produced by bacteria that can inactivate β-lactam antibiotics, such as ampicillin. By inhibiting β-lactamases, clavulanic acid allows ampicillin to remain active against β-lactamase-producing organisms. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Inhibition of β-lactamases.", "answer_choice": "B"}
